result.execSummary:
The defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Court orders that all Court costs, assessments, victim/ witness surcharges and restitution be paid within 1 year.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: to revocation sentence in  12CF5191.

REQUEST FOR EXPUNGEMENT IS DENIED.

As a convicted felon, defendant may not possess any firearm or body armor.
Defendant advised of voting ineligiblity.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javontae Jakell Taliaferro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in court with attorney Lisa M Schlieben.  Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to revocation sentence in 12CF5191 with credit for 0 days time served.  
Request for expungment is DENIED.
Court orders the payment of court costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge.
Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample and pay costs.
Court orders that all costs, assessments, surcharges and restitution by paid within 1 year, 5-15-2015, or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben in court, defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced from the House of Corrections for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 21. Defense requesting case 13CM004530 be transferred from Branch 47 (Siefert) to this court for purposes of pleading with the felony case. Court will accept the transfer.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 21 on 3-25-2014 at 8:30 for scheduling conference.

Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden for Lisa Schlieben.  Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for Jessica Ballenger for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: CO Ephraim Jones
State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense moves to dismiss.
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Javontae Jakell Taliaferro in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 21.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
